Of course! Here are some suggestions for discovering hidden gem art spaces in New York City:

1. Bushwick Open Studios: This annual event in September allows visitors to explore the studios and galleries of artists in Bushwick, many of which are off the beaten path.

2. Gallery Walks: NYC Art Gallery Week offers several self-guided gallery walks throughout Manhattan and Brooklyn, where you can discover new and emerging galleries.

3. Artist Collectives: Many artist collectives have spaces that are open to the public during certain times of the year, such as The Con Artist Collective or The Silent Barn.

4. Pop-up Art Shows: Look out for pop-up art shows, often in offbeat locations such as warehouses or abandoned buildings, that are not heavily advertised but offer unique and exciting exhibitions.

5. Artist-Run Spaces: Many artists have opened up their own spaces to showcase their work and that of their peers. This could be a great way to discover something new and unexpected.

6. Public Art Installations: New York City is full of public art installations, some of which are temporary or site-specific. Keep an eye out for these installations, as they can offer a unique perspective on contemporary art.

Remember, sometimes the best way to discover hidden art gems is to simply wander through different neighborhoods and see where your curiosity takes you. Enjoy the adventure!
